relevant_findings.examination: Patient was weak and exhausted with low blood pressure and sinus tachycardia; echocardiography showed a large pericardial effusion; elevated ventricular pacing threshold (2.75 V at 1.0 ms) and reduced sensing amplitude (5.6 mV).

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Elevated pacing threshold and decreased sensing amplitude observed 2 months prior; progressive symptoms with increasing thoracic pain before emergency presentation.
